intro: Ilex uaramae, commonly known as the Uarama holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically arranged in whorls. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ilex uaramae is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
